Posts.Content: I saw my GP last July as I felt so drained and tired all of the time. Various blood tests done and an X-ray. Results came back that my liver function was low. I went back a few weeks later for further blood tests and all were fine. But I've not really regained my energy. I'm not one for visiting Drs and I usually just 'get on with it'! The shoulder and upper back aches have been there for ages. I just put it down to a stressful job. Obviously finding a lump at the end of Jan was abit of a 'surprise'. By next Thursday it will be 2 weeks since the biopsy was taken. I know it's easy to say I'm probably just stressed, but I'm a pretty strong person. Such a bugger having to wait....
Posts.Title: Tiredness and aches.....

Posts.Content: Arrrr, of course! If you've got Critical Illness cover it's wrong to want it to be 'invasive', butvhaving the added worry of financial concerns it bad enough too! Anyway....may not come to that..... Thanks for your input.
Posts.Title: Tiredness and aches.....

Posts.Content: I took my CI cover out over 10 years ago. It's since been taken over by Friends Life. I need to look out my details, but FL website says in situ is not covered.
Posts.Title: Tiredness and aches.....

Posts.Content: Hi Prior to diagnosis did anyone suffer from tiredness even when they'd rested. And or shoulder back ache, pain, tenseness?
Posts.Title: Tiredness and aches.....

Posts.Content: I'm yet to get my biopsy results....it'll be 2 weeks next Thursday when they were taken. So the assumption is I'll get a call or they'll write to me??? The nurse said to expect a letter within 2 weeks, but they won't meet to discuss the findings until this tues coming (2 days time). I'm not being negative in thinking I do feel it'll be a BC diagnosis.  I've not been myself for a very long time. I'm self employed and 'just get on with things'. Long hours do leave my energy levels low, but I really haven't felt right for a very long time. At least I'm going into this being informed and bracing myself....if it's good news then blooming marvellous. If it's not; well I'll on it as a challenge....And I will be somewhat ready to embrace it. Critical illness cover will be the next challange! Being self employed is a bugger, and I know they don't pay out for 'in situ'!
Posts.Title: Tiredness and aches.....

Posts.Content: I'm waiting for biopsy results. It will be 2 weeks on Thursday! I will be fine if it's a negative result as I've psyched myself up for it. I just need to know now! My lump feels fairly big, the dr who did the biopsy said it's about the size of his thump nail...To me it feels bigger!
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: Thank you. It wasn't picked up on the mammogram. I have big boobs, I'm guessing that is why?
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: I see alot of people say their lump felt pea size. I'm wondering if anyone felt a larger lump. And am curious to know how big their lump actually was in reality.....
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: I'm aware not every lump is a cancer....!
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: Thank you. It wasn't picked up on the mammogram. I have big boobs, I'm guessing that is why?
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: I'm waiting for breast biopsy results, so at very early stages. Hopefully my outcome will be a positive one.  I've been worrying not only about that, but if the result is negative how will we cope financially? I'm self employed and work with children, plus have debts..... I have got critical illness cover, but I know they don't always pay out for BC.
Posts.Title: In panic mode

Posts.Content: Today I rang for my results as 14 days would be up tomorrow and I didn't want another weekend in limbo. Thankfully the lump is fine, just a fatty lump. Thank you for all of your kind support. Good luck everyone
Posts.Title: In panic mode

Posts.Content: But, if it's a positive result do I still get called in?
Posts.Title: Breast lump biopsy

Posts.Content: I found a lump on my breast, it's fairly big, doesn't mhurt or move. I was sent for tests 7 days ago. Was told it's not a cyst. The lump didn't show up on the mammogram (my boobs are pretty big, could this be the reason nothing was showing up?). I had a biopsy. How will I be told about the results? The breast nurse said I'd get a letter in around 2 weeks (so I have upto 7 days to wait). But, will I get a phone call if it's a negative result or just get the news in the post?
Posts.Title: Breast lump biopsy
